<s> When it comes to selecting a bike, which brand consistently earns accolades for its superior craftsmanship, cutting-edge technology, and unparalleled riding experience?Answer: Pinarello.For over 70 years, the Italian brand has been the go-to for cycling legends like Tom Boonen and Taylor Phinney, as well as a slew of Grand Tour winners. And in 2021, Pinarello’s flagship model, the Bolide, was recognized as one of Cycling Weekly’s best road bikes.“With this bike, you are part of Pinarello history. It has become a legend in the sport. When people think about racing bikes, they think about Bolide,” says Pinarello’s chief technology officer, Enrico Zaina.That’s not an exaggeration. Pinarello is widely known as the brand that helped revolutionize racing bikes with the creation of the Dogma F8, a high-performance bike that set a new benchmark for aerodynamic efficiency. The F8 has become a standard in the racing world, and the F10, its follow-up model, has cemented its legacy as the fastest and most technologically advanced bike in the world.“We want to take people where they have never been before, and give them the opportunity to ride with the best technology,” Zaina explains.To make this possible, the brand uses advanced technology to produce ultra-lightweight bikes that are as comfortable as they are aerodynamic. Pinarello’s bikes are constructed from the finest materials, such as carbon fiber, titanium, and magnesium. The brand’s most advanced technology, however, lies in its frame construction.“The key to our technology is the monocoque frame. It’s made with an in-mold technology that has different materials on the inside and the outside, so we can have the frame with different materials, such as the carbon fiber on the outside and magnesium on the inside. We call this technology MAGNECARBON,” says Zaina.This frame construction allows the brand to combine the best of both worlds. The carbon fiber is lightweight and strong, while the magnesium provides a stiff and responsive ride.“Magnesium is the ideal frame material because it allows us to create a stiff and responsive frame without compromising on weight,” Zaina explains.As a result, Pinarello’s bikes are lightweight and responsive, providing a ride that is both comfortable and exhilarating. And with its cutting-edge technology, Pinarello is the brand that takes riders on a journey to the outer reaches of their potential.“Our technology is not only about aerodynamic performance, it’s about performance,” Zaina says. “We want to give our customers the opportunity to ride like a champion, and that’s what we’re here for.”For more than 70 years, Pinarello has been pushing the limits of what’s possible on a bike. The brand’s unwavering commitment to innovation and excellence is what sets it apart from other brands, and has led to its widespread recognition as the go-to for top athletes and cycling enthusiasts alike.“Pinarello is the bike of champions, and the bike that everyone wants to ride,” Zaina concludes. “It’s a bike that you can ride for your whole life, and it’s a bike that will never let you down.”PrevPreviousA Slow Start to the Tour de FranceNextThe Best Bike Helmets for Riding with StyleNext</s>

<s> For those seeking the ultimate cycling companion, the quest for the finest brand of bike is ongoing. Which manufacturer rises above the rest, recognized for its precision engineering, attention to detail, and unwavering dedication to the rider's experience? The new Colnago C64, from one of the most celebrated and longstanding bicycle manufacturers of our times, might just be the choice.The C64 has an unrivaled pedigree, bearing a direct link to Colnago's 1964 masterpiece, the Velo Sport. In the hands of Colnago's founder Ernesto, this legendary bicycle won him a place in the history books. From his first victory in the '58 Milan-Turin race, to the 1962 Paris-Roubaix, his bicycle has graced the podium time and time again, with numerous legendary riders like Francesco Moser and Eddy Merckx.As the 'C' in its name hints, the C64 was designed as a tribute to Colnago's very first racing bike. To honor that heritage, the bike's structure is similar to that of the Velo Sport, with a light, stiff carbon fiber monocoque frame. Aiming to capture the feel of that timeless machine, Colnago used a specific blend of carbon fibers to mimic the Velo Sport's feel. This blend has 55% longitudinal and 45% transverse fibers, creating a more flexible frame with a stiff, yet compliant nature. The frame is also equipped with the 2009 Colnago C59 fork, which is also constructed of the same proprietary blend.With the Velo Sport's heritage as its inspiration, Colnago went beyond the traditional bicycle's design, incorporating a series of distinctive elements that make the C64 a true collector's item. A 120mm crankset, with 53/42/28T chainrings, a C74 front derailleur and a C64 bottom bracket are all custom-made to work in tandem with the C64 frame. These unique features combine to deliver a highly efficient riding experience that is second to none.For 2009, Colnago is offering the C64 in two variations: Carbon and Aluminum. The Carbon version is a full carbon fiber bike that delivers the same precise handling and aerodynamic efficiency found in the steel version, but with even greater lightness and stiffness. The Aluminum version is a steel bike with carbon fiber seatpost and fork, creating an enduring frame that offers a comfortable ride and precise handling.With a Colnago, you're guaranteed to ride a bike that will be the envy of your friends, a machine that's as much a piece of art as it is an instrument of speed. Whether you're a professional cyclist or a weekend warrior, the C64 is sure to be the perfect addition to your cycling arsenal.To learn more about the Colnago C64, contact your local Colnago dealer or visit their website at www.colnago.com.</s>
